com.tinkerpop.rexster.kibbles.sample

Class SimpleRootExtension

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tinkerpop.rexster.extension.AbstractRexsterExtension
      • com.tinkerpop.rexster.kibbles.sample.AbstractSampleExtension
        • com.tinkerpop.rexster.kibbles.sample.SimpleRootExtension
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RexsterExtension

    public class SimpleRootExtension
extends AbstractSampleExtension
    An extension that showcases the methods available to those who wish to extend Rexster.

    This sample focuses on root-level extensions. Root-level extensions add the extension to the root of the specified ExtensionPoint. No additional pathing is taken into consideration when routing to the service method, therefore, if more than one root-level extension is specified then Rexster may appear to misbehave. Rexster will choose the first extension method match that it can find when processing a request.

    • Method Detail

      • doWorkOnGraph

        public ExtensionResponse doWorkOnGraph(com.tinkerpop.blueprints.Graph graph)
        By adding the @RexsterContext attribute to the "graph" parameter, the graph requested gets automatically injected into the extension. Therefore, when the following URI is requested:

        http://localhost:8182/graphs/tinkergraph/tp/simple-root

        the graph called "graphname" will be pushed into this method.

      • doWorkOnEdge

        public ExtensionResponse doWorkOnEdge(com.tinkerpop.blueprints.Edge edge)
        By adding the @RexsterContext attribute to the "edge" parameter, the edge requested gets automatically injected into the extension. Therefore, when the following URI is requested:

        http://localhost:8182/graphs/tinkergraph/edges/11/tp/simple-root

        the edge with an ID of 1 in the graph called "tinkergraph" will be pushed into this method.

      • doWorkOnVertex

        public ExtensionResponse doWorkOnVertex(com.tinkerpop.blueprints.Vertex vertex)
        By adding the @RexsterContext attribute to the "vertex" parameter, the edge requested gets automatically injected into the extension. Therefore, when the following URI is requested:

        http://localhost:8182/graphs/tinkergraph/vertices/1/tp/simple-root

        the edge with an ID of 1 in the graph called "tinkergraph" will be pushed into this method.
